CatDescriptText: Charles Jennings, millworker, 5356 Hillcrest Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "I do. They operated before, and therefore I wonder why they shouldn't be allowed to operate in the Hill District after the beautification."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Jennings, wearing dark overcoat, and hat, standing in front of Bud Saunder's flower store in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
